band.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: a group of musicians, especially a group that plays popular music
band.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: The band was playing old Beatles songs.
I grew up playing in rock bands.
They formed a band when they were still at school.
The entertainment includes a disco and live band.
band.translation[0].definitions[0].note_: In this meaning, band is usually followed by a singular verb
The band has made a video
The band have made a video
band.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: a group of people formed because of a common belief or purpose
band.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: a range of numbers within a system
band.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: Interest rates stayed within a relatively narrow band.
band.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: a flat narrow piece of something with one end joined to the other to form a circle
band.translation[0].definitions[3].examp: papers held together with a rubber band
a slim gold band on her finger
band.translation[0].definitions[4].defin: a narrow area of light, colour, land etc that is different from the areas around it
band.translation[0].definitions[4].examp: The birds have a distinctive blue band round their eyes.
band.translation[0].note_box[0].sections: They formed their own band and released a single.
He took up the saxophone and joined the school band.
Budd played in a rock band.
He led his own band in Florida and played in clubs.
The band is performing live on Saturday night.
We were on the dance floor waiting for the band to strike up.
He’s the saxophonist in a jazz band.
A brass band was playing in the park.
There’s a live band at the club on Saturday nights.
She plays the trumpet in the school band.
a military band with their brass and their drums
He was one of the original band members.
band.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: to put people or things into different groups, usually according to income, value, or price
band.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: After valuation, properties will be banded in groups of £20,000 or more.
